METS:xmlData.dcterms:title: Slovenska kultura pod sovjetskim vplivom
METS:xmlData.dcterms:alternative: Slovene Culture under the Influence of the Soviet Union
METS:xmlData.dcterms:creator: Gabrič, Aleš
METS:xmlData.dcterms:abstract: The close political attachment of Yugoslavia, and with it also of Slovenia, to the Soviet Union immediately after the Second World War brought about the strengthening of cultural ties between the two countries as Slovenia started to follow Soviet cultural and political models. However, the Cominform conflict between Yugoslavia and the Soviet Union effectively ended this and considerably diminished cultural coopération between the two countries; the variables of the intensity of their cultural exchange are indicated by a number of statistical data. However, the changes in cultural politics nevertheless did not dispense with control over cultural production but merely reformed control techniques.

Tesna politična naslonitev Jugoslavije na Sovjetsko zvezo takoj po koncu druge svetovne vojne je v Jugoslavijo in s tem tudi Slovenijo prinesla tudi posnemanje sovjetskega kulturnopolitičnega modela in krepitev kulturnega sodelovanja s Sovjetsko zvezo. Toda po informbirojevskem sporu med Jugoslavijo in Sovjetsko zvezo je bilo kmalu konec posnemanja sovjetskega kulturnega vzora, opazen pa je bil tudi zastoj pri kulturnem sodelovanju. Spreminjanje intenzivnosti kulturnega sodelovanja prikazujejo številni statistični kazalci, spremembe v kulturni politiki pa niso odpravile nadzora nad kulturno ustvarjalnostjo, temveč le reformirale način nadzora.
METS:xmlData.dcterms:subject: slovenska kultura
sovjetski vpliv
kulturno sodelovanje
Slovene culture
Soviet influence
cultural cooperation

METS:xmlData.entity:description: Tesna politična naslonitev Jugoslavije na Sovjetsko zvezo takoj po koncu druge svetovne vojne je v Jugoslavijo in s tem tudi Slovenijo prinesla tudi posnemanje sovjetskega kulturnopolitičnega modela in krepitev kulturnega sodelovanja s Sovjetsko zvezo. Toda po informbirojevskem sporu med Jugoslavijo in Sovjetsko zvezo je bilo kmalu konec posnemanja sovjetskega kulturnega vzora, opazen pa je bil tudi zastoj pri kulturnem sodelovanju. Spreminjanje intenzivnosti kulturnega sodelovanja prikazujejo številni statistični kazalci, spremembe v kulturni politiki pa niso odpravile nadzora nad kulturno ustvarjalnostjo, temveč le reformirale način nadzora.

The close political attachment of Yugoslavia, and with it also of Slovenia, to the Soviet Union immediately after the Second World War brought about the strengthening of cultural ties between the two countries as Slovenia started to follow Soviet cultural and political models. However, the Cominform conflict between Yugoslavia and the Soviet Union effectively ended this and considerably diminished cultural coopération between the two countries; the variables of the intensity of their cultural exchange are indicated by a number of statistical data. However, the changes in cultural politics nevertheless did not dispense with control over cultural production but merely reformed control techniques.
